title: 105_s535
content: The "Morris K. Udall Parkinson's Research Act of 1997" aims to expand federal investment in Parkinson's research and improve coordination among NIH institutes. It also focuses on enhancing care for individuals with Parkinson's and their caregivers. This Act amends the Public Health Service Act to include provisions for Parkinson's disease research. The Director of NIH will establish a program for Parkinson's disease research and training, coordinating with national research institutes and holding research planning conferences every two years. The Director of NIH will award Core Center Grants to establish Morris K. Udall Research Centers for Parkinson's disease research and training. Each center funded will focus on innovative multidisciplinary research and training, with a limit of 10 grants awarded. The Director of NIH awards Core Center Grants to establish Morris K. Udall Research Centers for Parkinson's disease research and training. Centers must be part of an institution or consortium, conduct basic and clinical research, and may offer training programs, education for health professionals, public information dissemination, and data collaboration. The Morris K. Udall Research Centers for Parkinson's disease research and training aim to establish a nationwide data system, an Information Clearinghouse, and a national education program to enhance knowledge and understanding of Parkinson's disease. Additionally, centers may offer training programs with stipends. The Director of NIH may establish a grant program to support investigators with a proven record of excellence and innovation in Parkinson's disease research. Support for a center under this subsection may be for a period not exceeding five years, with the possibility of extension for additional periods based on peer review recommendations. The NIH may establish a grant program to support researchers in Parkinson's disease research for up to 5 years. $100,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 1998, with additional funding for 1999 and 2000.
